alert.note: Alert for Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:52AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Huerfano, east central Custer and west central Pueblo Counties through 530 AM MDT... At 451 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Junkins Burn Scar, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. Enhanced flow in drainages is expected. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Huerfano, east central Custer and west central Pueblo Counties, including the following locations... San Isabel, Beulah, Rye and Colorado City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet; Wet Mountains above 10000 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft
